CatDescriptText: Rosalie White, housewife, Uniontown and Charles P. Hall, Jr., Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mrs. White's answer reads: "I'm against it, because it's betting."  Mr. Hall's answer reads: "I'm in favor of it.  Every other state has a little gambling.  And it would be a good thing for Pittsburgh, because there would be [answer ends]"
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Rosalie White wearing light colored floral short sleeve blouse and dark skirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Charles P. Hall, Jr. wearing moustache and dark shirt with rolled sleeves, standing on Liberty Avenue with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
